intro: Kokia drynarioides, commonly known as the silver kokia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
